metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5732 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the form function in theWP_Nav_Menu_Widget class in wp-includes/default-widgets.php in WordPressbefore 4.2.4 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTMLvia a widget title.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5732` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.4+dfsg-1').
